name: Ext.Factory
doc:
Manages factories for families of classes (classes with a common alias prefix). The factory for a class family is a function stored as a static on Ext.Factory. These are created either by directly calling Ext.Factory.define or by using the Ext.mixin.Factoryable interface.

To illustrate, consider the layout system's use of aliases. The hbox layout maps to the "layout.hbox" alias that one typically provides via the layout config on a Container.

Under the covers this maps to a call like this:

 Ext.Factory.layout('hbox');

Or possibly:

 Ext.Factory.layout({
     type: 'hbox'
 });

The value of the layout config is passed to the Ext.Factory.layout function. The exact signature of a factory method matches create.

To define this factory directly, one could call Ext.Factory.define like so:

 Ext.Factory.define('layout', 'auto');  // "layout.auto" is the default type

members.name: aliasPrefix
members.doc: The prefix to apply to type values to form a complete alias. This defaults to the proper value in most all cases and should not need to be specified.
members.short_doc: The prefix to apply to type values to form a complete alias. ...

members.name: defaultProperty
members.doc: The config property to set when the factory is given a config that is a string.
members.short_doc: The config property to set when the factory is given a config that is a string. ...

members.name: defaultType
members.doc: An optional type to use if none is given to the factory at invocation. This is a suffix added to the aliasPrefix. For example, if aliasPrefix="layout." and defaultType="hbox" the default alias is "layout.hbox". This is an alternative to xclass so only one should be provided.
members.short_doc: An optional type to use if none is given to the factory at invocation. ...

members.name: instanceProp
members.doc: The property that identifies an object as instance vs a config.
members.short_doc: The property that identifies an object as instance vs a config. ...

members.name: xclass
members.doc: The full classname of the type of instance to create when none is provided to the factory. This is an alternative to defaultType so only one should be specified.
members.short_doc:
The full classname of the type of instance to create when none is provided to the
factory. ...

members.name: defaultClass
members.doc: The Class reference of the type of instance to create when none is provided to the factory. This property is set from xclass when the factory instance is created.
members.short_doc:
The Class reference of the type of instance to create when none is provided to the
factory. ...

members.name: create
members.doc: Creates an instance of this class family given configuration options.

params.name: config
params.doc: The configuration or instance (if an Object) or just the type (if a String) describing the instance to create.

properties.name: xclass
properties.doc: The full class name of the class to create.

properties.name: type
properties.doc: The type string to add to the alias prefix for this factory.

params.name: defaultType
params.doc: The type to create if no type is contained in the config.

members.short_doc: Creates an instance of this class family given configuration options. ...

members.name: dataIdentifier
members.doc: Returns an instance of an ID generator based on the ID you pass in.
members.short_doc: Returns an instance of an ID generator based on the ID you pass in. ...

members.name: define
members.doc:
For example, the layout alias family could be defined like this:

 Ext.Factory.define('layout', {
     defaultType: 'auto'
 });

To define multiple families at once:

 Ext.Factory.define({
     layout: {
         defaultType: 'auto'
     }
 });

params.name: config
params.doc: An object specifying the config for the Ext.Factory to be created. If a string is passed it is treated as the defaultType.

short_doc: Manages factories for families of classes (classes with a common alias prefix). ...
